chunks.en: It all depends on the competition. Competitors are stupid. That's right, I'm talking about Creation of the Gods, Operation Red Sea, and Legend of the Condor Heroes.

I watched the first one with my wife, and we both liked it a lot. Later, when we went out to play, we bought two of the few clay figures in our house. Today, my child is at school, so I took half a day off and came out with my wife to watch the second one together. When we went back, my wife said that next time the third one comes out, we will come and watch it together again.
Oh my, such a highbrow and unpopular V2EX. Then I can only borrow the Premier's words, the people love to see it, if you don't like it, who do you think you are?
@zfybot Pale and monotonous plot, mixed with chuunibyou lines and disgusting toilet humor, it's hard to say what you watched after watching a movie.

But if you position it under the heroic theme of Marvel, it's actually just so-so.
'This is the best animated film I have ever seen.' My contrarian attribute is back, and I immediately have an idea, if that's the case, have you seen 'WALLÂ·E'?

There are still many people who have just returned to the city to work and have not yet had time. After this group of people returning to the city have time, it is estimated that the box office of Ne Zha 2 can reach about 6-7 billion. It is already 5.3 billion now. Ne Zha 2 is a hit again this time.

In addition to the good reputation brought by the first film, there are also many production teams of domestic animation who participated in the production. A Record of a Mortalâ€™s Journey to Immortality, Boonie Bears, Deep Sea, White Snake, Chang An, etc., a total of more than 100 animation teams joined hands to create Ne Zha 2. This is the first time I have seen domestic animation companies working together so wholeheartedly, just for Chinese animation.

Because there was a lot of buzz online, I was planning to go see it. Before going out, I watched the trailer, and the line 'I don't care if I live or die, I just want you to die' was so cringe that I completely gave up the idea of watching the movie.
Looking back, I thought the first movie was also very average. I only remember the line 'My fate is up to me, not heaven', which made people feel not just embarrassment, but discomfort.
The reason is that it's better not to let a little kid tell great truths. I just want to say, can you make money to support yourself before you argue with the heavens and the earth.

In short, this film is not suitable for adults to watch because it is too childish; it is also not recommended for adults to take children to watch, it will only make them go further and further down the road of being a mischievous child.
@donnylai They've been fed crap for too long, so when a piece of crap that doesn't taste so strong comes along, everyone thinks it's a treat.

Before, I saw evaluations on the Internet and in my circle of friends saying that it was very good. When I went to see it, I was a little skeptical about my life. Every time there was a joke, I heard the laughter of the children in the audience, and my wife and I felt a little helpless.
The jokes in the first half were a bit vulgar and awkward, a bit childish. In the second half, when the fight started, the pictures were indeed grand, but there were too many slogans in this step.
Also, the squid eating itself and all the scorched Chen Tangguan people are a bit hellish.
The stupid villain shouts slogans, and the plot of the apprentice and master in the easter eggs makes me dream of Boonie Bears.
I've been holding back for several days and didn't dare to complain on other platforms for fear of being scolded by fans.
As a commercial film, it's okay, but it's still a bit unacceptable if it's the best in China.
The plot and special effects are good, but the jokes and sentimental moments are too awkward.
Being able to win the box office champion is due to the right timing, location, and people.
